intro: Onoseris fraterna, commonly known as the Fraternally Blushing Daisy, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features showy yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its botanical characteristics make it an attractive and ecologically valuable species in native plant gardens.
